content.webTitle: Premier League: Everton chase Portugal striker Hugo Almeida

fields.headline: Everton chase Almeida to bolster striking options
fields.bodyText: Everton have approached Werder Bremen with a view to signing the Portugal international striker Hugo Almeida on loan until the end of the season. Victor Anichebe is currently the only Everton forward available to the manager, David Moyes, who is hoping to improve his attacking options before Sunday's FA Cup fourth-round tie with Liverpool at Anfield. Almeida, 24, who joined Bremen from Porto in 2007, is one of several strikers Everton are pursuing this month and a loan-deal offer has been made to the German club. Moyes is also expected to complete the signing of Sligo Rovers' 20-year-old right-back, Seamus Coleman, for a fee of around £200,000 this week.
